revised_title: Exploring the Physiology and Production of the Human Voice
tldr: This article delves into the human voice's various modifications, such as timbre, intensity, and pitch, and the organs involved in voice production. It discusses the larynx as the most important organ and explains the vibratory movements of stretched membranous surfaces, including experiments on artificial vibrating tongues and the larynxes of animals. The article also explores the production of simple tones of voice and the associated actions of numerous muscles.
